item.title: Lower Lobe Cargo Compartment Smoke Detection System (Forward, Aft) – Flight Deck Test System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided smoke detector system integrity is verified before each departure.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "LOWER LOBE COMP SMOKE DET SYS INOP". Enter Item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify integrity of lower cargo smoke detection system as follows:
Close circuit breakers (MM 26-16-00/501).
Select either one of the following switches to the ENABLE position:
S2089 Ground Test Enable Switch (P461).
S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 in the left Main Equipment Center.
Set the CDU to the CMC main menu and press LINE SELECT key for GROUND TEST.
When screen displays ATA name and chapter, select 26 FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM.
Press LINE SELECT key to initiate FIRE/OVHT TEST. TEST IN PROGRESS will display for the duration of the test. Upon completion of the test, TEST PASSED or FIRE TEST FAIL will be displayed on the CDU.
If TEST PASSED is displayed, system integrity is verified.
If FIRE TEST FAIL is displayed:
Ensure S2090 Remote Test Enable Switch (RCDU) at STA 400 in the left Main Equipment Center is left in the NORM position.

note.para: FIRE TEST FAIL may appear because of a fault in a different fire/overheat detection system.

numlitem.para: Verify the following EICAS/CMC fault messages do not appear on the CDU.
FIRE CARGO FWD
FIRE CARGO AFT
FWD CARGO FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-A FAIL INTERFACE FAIL
FWD CARGO FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-B FAIL INTERFACE FAIL
AFT CARGO FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-A FAIL INTERFACE FAIL
AFT CARGO FIRE ALARM SIGNAL>MAWEA MM-B FAIL INTERFACE FAIL
If the above fault messages appear, seek corrective action - dispatch is not allowed.
Check for the following Status messages on the lower EICAS display:
If the above status messages appear, seek corrective action or dispatch is allowed provided the associated lobe cargo compartment remains empty or contains only empty ULD’s, or fly away kits.
Restore Aircraft to its required configuration.
While not required, an inoperative smoke detector may be deactivated as follows:
Remove and stow the electrical connector from affected detector.

With the electrical connector removed the AFOLTS will automatically configure for single loop operation and the FIRE/OVHT test should indicate passed with a status message for the inoperative detector.
